titleStmt.title: A proclamation against the vnreuere[n]t disputers and talkers of the sacramente of the body and blood of Christ commonly called the sacrament of the aultar, set furth by the Kynges Maiestie, with thassente and co[n]sent of his most deere vncle, Edwarde Duke of Somerset, gouernour of his moste royall person, and of hys realmes, dominio[n]s and subiectes protector, and other of hys highnes most honorable pryuey counsaill, the .xxvii. daye of Decembre, in the first yeare of his Maiesties most gratious reigne.
Proclamations. 1547-12-27
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1547-1553 : Edward VI)

publicationStmt.publisher: In ædibus Richardi Graftoni regij impressoris. Cum privilegio ad imprimendum solum,

notesStmt.note: Recites Act of 1 Edward VI against revilers of the Sacrament--Steele.
First leaf only filmed on reel 10.
Reproduction of the original in the Society of Antiquaries.
Appears at reels 10 and 152 (Society of Antiquaries copy).
